descriptions: Student cannot identify any stressors or provides inaccurate information.
Student identifies 1-2 stressors with limited accuracy.
Student identifies 3-4 stressors with some inaccuracies.
Student identifies 3-4 stressors accurately and generally understands their impact.
Student identifies multiple stressors accurately and explains their impact on well-being.
Student comprehensively identifies various stressors, accurately explains their impact, and demonstrates insightful understanding of personal triggers.
Student does not suggest or attempt any stress management techniques.
Student suggests one ineffective or inappropriate stress management technique.
Student suggests 1-2 basic stress management techniques but struggles with application.
Student lists 2-3 stress management techniques and can generally describe how to use them.
Student appropriately applies several stress management techniques, showing some understanding of their effectiveness.
Student skillfully and creatively applies a variety of stress management techniques, demonstrating a clear understanding of their personal effectiveness and making adjustments as necessary.
Student does not attempt to evaluate the effectiveness of any stress management techniques.
Student provides a vague or inaccurate evaluation of technique effectiveness.
Student provides a limited evaluation of technique effectiveness with little justification.
Student provides a general evaluation of technique effectiveness with some supporting reasons.
Student evaluates the effectiveness of techniques used, providing clear and logical reasons for their assessment.
Student provides a thorough and insightful evaluation of technique effectiveness, considering various factors and adapting strategies for optimal results.
